title: Nigeria remembers master wood carver
content: Kasali Akangbe Ogun, who came from a long line of wood carvers and wanted to preserve local traditions, has been buried following his death after a brief illness.

originalTitle: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
title: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
content: Police say armed gangs burst into the two churches in Kurmin Wali, Kaduna state, during Sunday service.

originalTitle: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus
title: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus
content: The Ethiopian Orthodox festival of Timket, or Epiphany, commemorates the baptism of Jesus in the Jordan.

originalTitle: Syria fighting live: Ceasefire under duress as army moves in to Hasakah
title: Syria fighting live: Ceasefire under duress as army moves in to Hasakah
content: About 200 ISIL detainees escaped from al-Shaddadi prison with tit-for-tat allegations on who freed them.

originalTitle: Australia closes dozens of east coast beaches after shark attacks
title: Australia closes dozens of east coast beaches after shark attacks
content: NSW coastline has seen four shark attacks since Sunday, as experts say rainy conditions draw sharks to beach areas.

originalTitle: Vietnam’s To Lam vows to fight corruption, pledges 10% economic growth
title: Vietnam’s To Lam vows to fight corruption, pledges 10% economic growth
content: The Communist Party leader is reportedly considering a dual role as party chief and Vietnam's president.

originalTitle: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
title: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
content: Kaja Kallas, the EU's foreign policy chief, said the bloc has "no interest to pick a fight, but we will hold our ground".

originalTitle: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
title: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
content: Transatlantic relations aren't broken, though they are damaged. And if Europeans want to try to cut through with Trump, they'll have to stick together, writes Europe Editor Katya Adler

originalTitle: Spain to hold three days of mourning for victims of high-speed train crash
title: Spain to hold three days of mourning for victims of high-speed train crash
content: At least 40 people died in Sunday's collision in  southern Spain, the worst crash the country has seen in more than a decade.

originalTitle: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
title: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
content: Charalampos Kostoulas earned Brighton a point with a stunning overhead kick but  were the Seagulls right to be angry over an earlier penalty award?

originalTitle: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
title: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
content: This is the story of how an unsigned contract that lay hidden in a bungalow for more than 50 years could have changed the course of English football.

originalTitle: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
content: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?
